sourceMeaningMnemonic: When a <radical>man</radical> meets a <radical>tiger</radical> he makes the tiger his <kanji>captive</kanji>. Men are pretty crappy like that. They see tigers and they want to put them in cages, so the poor tiger becomes a captive of the man.
meaningInfo: Picture the sad tiger captive and the man laughing as he pokes at it. Tigers shouldn't be captives but when men find them they always seem to do this anyway.
readingMnemonic: The <kanji>captive</kanji> tiger is even sadder because the man put him in a <reading>ro</reading>be (<ja>りょ</ja>) and is making him act like a human. Tigers look good in robes, but they don't really enjoy being forced into people clothing.
readingInfo: Picture the poor captive tiger being stuffed into a bathrobe and paraded around a cage for the man.
